abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the North-South Electricity
            Transmission Project for Kazakhstan were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: continuity of Bank and Borrower staff
            helps to create mutual respect and understanding which in
            turn facilitates resolution of problems that arise during
            implementation. Close involvement of an experienced
            Borrower/Implementing Agency in project design, together
            with attentiveness to their views, helps to build a
            cooperative relationship between the Bank and the
            Borrower/Implementing Agency. Continuous donor coordination
            and allocation of resources can result in expeditious
            implementation of a large project. Flexible load following
            generation capacity should be developed and made available
            before the launch of a balancing market.
